enable.label: Enabled
enable.comment: If disabled, this module will not protect the integrity of your data.

product_attributes.label: Purified Attributes
product_attributes.comment: All selected attributes will be purified prior to saving.

category_attributes.label: Purified Attributes
category_attributes.comment: All selected category attributes will be purified prior to saving.

html.label: HTML Settings
html.comment:
<script type="text/javascript">
                                document.observe("dom:loaded", function() {
                                    if($('integrity_general_enable').value == 0) {
                                         Element.up($('integrity_html')).hide();
                                    }
                                });
                                Event.observe('integrity_general_enable', 'change', function() {
                                    if(this.value == 1) {
                                        Element.up($('integrity_html')).show();
                                    } else {
                                        Element.up($('integrity_html')).hide();
                                    }
                                })
                            </script>

doctype.label: Doctype
doctype.comment: This is the doctype to use during the filtering process.
doctype.tooltip: Unless this is a legacy store, this should be set to HTML5

allowed_elements.label: Allowed HTML Elements
allowed_elements.comment: Any element not selected in the above list will be removed from all HTML content.

allowed_attributes.label: Allowed HTML Attributes
allowed_attributes.comment: Any attribute not selected in the above list will be removed from all HTML content.

constrain_classes.label: Constrain Classes
constrain_classes.comment: Allows you to manually specify a set of allowed classes. If set to no, all classes are allowed.

allowed_classes.label: Allowed Properties
allowed_classes.comment: Only the classes specified above shall be allowed.

allowed_frame_targets.label: Allowed Frame Targets
allowed_frame_targets.comment: All except for the selected frame targets will be removed.

allowed_rel.label: Allowed Rel
allowed_rel.comment: All except for the selected rel attribute values will be removed.

default_image_alt.label: Default Image Alt
default_image_alt.comment: This is the content of the alt tag of an image if the user had not previously specified an alt attribute. This applies to all images without a valid alt attribute, as opposed to the 'Default Invalid Image Alt' field which only applies to invalid images, and overrides in the case of an invalid image. If this field is not specified, then a default of the basename of the src tag for the image is used as the alt.

default_invalid_image.label: Default Invalid Image
default_invalid_image.comment: This is the default image an img tag will be pointed to if it does not have a valid src attribute.

default_invalid_image_alt.label: Default Invalid Image Alt
default_invalid_image_alt.comment: This applies to all images without a valid src attribute.

allow_ids.label: Allow IDs
allow_ids.comment: Allows the ID attribute in HTML. This is disabled by default due to the fact that without proper configuration user input can easily break the validation of a webpage by specifying an ID that is already on the surrounding HTML.

id_blacklist.label: Blacklist IDs
id_blacklist.comment: The IDs specified above will be stripped from all HTML.

auto_paragraph.label: Auto Paragraph
auto_paragraph.comment:
This directive turns on auto-paragraphing, where double newlines are converted in to paragraphs whenever possible. Auto-paragraphing always applies to inline elements or text in the root node, to inline elements or text with double newlines in nodes that allow paragraph tags, and to double newlines in paragraph tags.
p tags must be allowed for this directive to take effect.

display_link_uri.label: Auto Paragraph
display_link_uri.comment: This directive turns on the in-text display of URIs in <a> tags, and disables those links.

linkify.label: Linkify
linkify.comment: This directive turns on linkification, auto-linking http, ftp and https URLs. a tags with the href attribute must be allowed.

remove_empty.label: Remove Empty Elements
remove_empty.comment: When enabled, empty elements that contribute no semantic information to the document will be removed.

remove_empty_nbsp.label: Remove &nbsp; Elements
remove_empty_nbsp.comment: When enabled, elements that contain only &nbsp; characters will be treated as empty and removed.

remove_empty_spans.label: Remove Attributeless Spans
remove_empty_spans.comment: This directive causes span tags without any attributes to be removed. It will also remove spans that had all attributes removed during processing.

allow_duplicates.label: Allow Duplicates
allow_duplicates.comment: By default, HTML Purifier removes duplicate CSS properties, like color:red; color:blue. If this is set to yes, duplicate properties are allowed.
allow_duplicates.tooltip: It is recommended to leave this setting disabled.

allow_important.label: Allow Important
allow_important.comment: This parameter determines whether or not !important cascade modifiers should be allowed in user CSS. If set to no, !important will stripped.
allow_important.tooltip: It is recommended to leave this setting disabled.

allow_tricky_css.label: Allow "Tricky" CSS
allow_tricky_css.comment: Tricky CSS properties/values can drastically modify page layout or be used for deceptive practices but do not directly constitute a security risk. For example, display:none; is considered a tricky property that will only be allowed if this directive is set to yes.
allow_tricky_css.tooltip: It is recommended to disable "Tricky" CSS.

constrain_fonts.label: Constrain Fonts
constrain_fonts.comment: Allows you to manually specify a set of allowed fonts. If set to no, all fonts are allowed. This directive affects generic names (serif, sans-serif, monospace, cursive, fantasy) as well as specific font families.

allowed_fonts.label: Allowed Fonts
allowed_fonts.comment: Each font added to the list will be whitelisted. The font names are case insensitive.

constrain_properties.label: Constrain Properties
constrain_properties.comment: Allows you to manually specify a set of allowed properties. If set to no, all properties are allowed.

allowed_properties.label: Allowed Properties
allowed_properties.comment: Each property selected from the list will be whitelisted.
allowed_properties.tooltip: Hint: Hold the control key to select multiple values.

max_img_length.label: Max Image Size
max_img_length.comment: This parameter sets the maximum allowed length on img tags, effectively the width and height properties. Only absolute units of measurement (in, pt, pc, mm, cm) and pixels (px) are allowed. This is in place to prevent imagecrash attacks, leave blank at your own risk.

allow_proprietary.label: Allow Proprietary
allow_proprietary.comment: Whether or not to allow safe, proprietary CSS values.
allow_proprietary.tooltip: Proprietary CSS properties may not display correctly on all browsers. User experience may suffer if this is abused.

allow_iframes.label: Allow IFrames
allow_iframes.comment:
Note - when you allow an iframe to be loaded, you are trusting a third party to display unfiltered content on your store.
Use with caution.

allowed_iframe_sources.label: Allowed IFrame Sources
allowed_iframe_sources.comment:
Each source added to the list will be whitelisted.
Subdomains are allowed.

disable_external_links.label: Disable External Links
disable_external_links.comment: Disables links to external websites. This is a highly effective anti-spam and anti-pagerank-leech measure, but comes at a hefty price: no links or images outside of your domain will be allowed. Non-linkified URIs will still be preserved.

uri_host.label: URI Host
uri_host.comment: Defines the domain name of the server, so we can determine whether or an absolute URI is from your website or not. Not strictly necessary, as users should be using relative URIs to reference resources on your website. It will, however, let you use absolute URIs to link to subdomains of the domain you post here: i.e. example.com will allow sub.example.com.
